The Three Truths

TRUTH I

The soft must be shielded.

Your therapist told you to "sit with the discomfort." Dr. Whiskers says to encase the discomfort in 40 pounds of tempered steel and then sit with it. The discomfort will not enjoy this. Good.

TRUTH II

The shield must be worn.

Not held. Not displayed. Not metaphorical. Worn. To every session. To the grocery store. To your mother's house on Thanksgiving. Especially to your mother's house on Thanksgiving.

TRUTH III

They walk among us.

We do not speak of the Third Truth at orientation. You will understand when you see them. You may already have.

Regarding the Unbidden Ones

They arrived at the First Gathering in 2019. No one invited them. The one dressed as a large sun stood near the altar for eleven hours without moving. The one in the dolphin suit blessed the communion gauntlets. We do not know how many there are.

We have asked them to leave. We have asked politely. We have asked with lawyers. The dolphin ate the cease-and-desist. The sun simply watched.

It is now doctrine that the Unbidden Ones are sacred. This was easier than the alternative.

If you encounter an Unbidden One in the parking lot, do not make eye contact. Do not offer food. If the one in the bear costume approaches you, walk ‚Äî do not run ‚Äî toward the nearest armored parishioner. They cannot help, but you will feel better standing near metal.

The Daily Office

The Clinking 05:30 AM

Morning meditation. All attendees in full plate. The sound of 200 people breathing in steel.

Dr. Whiskers makes biscuits on the altar cloth. We observe in silence. Some weep.

The Patrol 03:00 PM

Armored parishioners walk the grounds. The Unbidden follow at a respectful but unsettling distance.
